==Adverbs==
*{{l|ja|もう}} – already (''mō'')
*{{l|ja|まだ}} – still, yet (''mada'')
*{{l|ja|ずっと}} – always (''zutto'')
*{{l|ja|とても}} – very (''totemo'')

*{{l|ja|そう}} – like that (''sō'')
*{{l|ja|ああ}} – in that other way (''ā'')
*{{l|ja|どう}} – how (''dō'')
*{{l|ja|しばしば}} – often (''shibashiba'')

==Pre-noun adjectival==
*{{l|ja|この}} – this (''kono'')
*{{l|ja|その}} – that (''sono'')
*{{l|ja|あの}} – that (''ano'')
*{{l|ja|どの}} – which (''dono'')

==Interjections==
*{{l|ja|はい}} – yes (''hai'')
*{{l|ja|いいえ}} – no (''iie'')

==[[:Category:Japanese conjunctions|Conjunctions]]==
*{{l|ja|でも }} - but (''demo'')
*{{l|ja|しかし}} – but, however (''shikashi'')
*{{l|ja|そして}} – and then, Then… (''soshite'')
*{{l|ja|それに}} – besides (''soreni'')
*{{l|ja|なぜなら}} – that is because, being because (''nazenara'')

==Terminations of verbs==
*{{l|ja|う}}、{{l|ja|よう}} – volitional ending [う for ''u''-verbs, よう for ''ru''-verbs]: "Let's…" or "I will" (''u'', ''yō'')
*{{l|ja|せる}}、{{l|ja|させる}} – causative ending [せる for ''u''-verbs, させる for ''ru''-verbs]: to make [someone do something], to allow (''seru'', ''saseru'')
*{{l|ja|れる}}、{{l|ja|られる}} – passive verb ending [れる for ''u''-verbs, られる for ''ru''-verbs]: to be <verbed> [e.g., 食べられる, "to be eaten"] (''reru'', ''rareru'')
*{{l|ja|そう|そうだ}} – indicates that it ''seems'' the verb occurs [e.g., "It seems he ate"] (''sōda'')
*{{l|ja|た}} – informal past-tense (''ta'')
*{{l|ja|たい}} – indicates desire to perform verb (''tai'')
*{{l|ja|だろう}} – indicates that it ''seems'' the verb occurs; also used to ask whether the verb occurs (''darō'')
*{{l|ja|ない}}、{{l|ja|ん}} – informal negative (''nai'', ''n'') [ん is a slurred version and sounds a little masculine]
*{{l|ja|ぬ}} – archaic informal negative ["he hath", "thou didst", etc.] (''nu'')
*{{l|ja|ます}} – formal non-past ending (''masu'')

==Particles==
===Case===
<!--格助詞-->
*{{l|ja|が}} – subject marker, but (''ga'')
*{{l|ja|で}} – at, by (''de'')
*{{l|ja|と}} – and, with (''to'')
*{{l|ja|に}} – indirect object marker (''ni'')
*{{l|ja|の}} – possession marker, of (''no'')
*{{l|ja|へ}} – to (''e'') [Note: へ is normally read ''he'', but when used as this particle its reading changes to ''e'']
*{{l|ja|まで}} – to (''made'')
*{{l|ja|から}} – from (''kara'')
*{{l|ja|より}} – than (''yori'')
*{{l|ja|を}} – direct object marker (''o'')

===Conjunctive===
<!--接続助詞-->
*{{l|ja|および}}、{{l|ja|及び}} – and; as well as (''oyobi'')
*{{l|ja|か}} – whether (''ka'')
*{{l|ja|かも}} – might be, possible that (''kamo'')

*{{l|ja|それとも}} – or (''soretomo'')
*{{l|ja|だの}} – things like <list of things>, including, such things as (''dano'')

*{{l|ja|て}} – ''te'' form of verb or adjective [see [[wikipedia:Japanese verb conjugations and adjective declensions#Te form|explanation]]]
*{{l|ja|と}} – when, if, that (''to'')
*{{l|ja|ながら}} – while, though, both (''nagara'')
*{{l|ja|ならびに}} – as well as (''narabini'')
*{{l|ja|なり}} – whether or not (''nari'')
*{{l|ja|に}} – to <somewhere>, by <someone> (''ni'')
*{{l|ja|の}} – possession (''no'')
*{{l|ja|ので}} – so (''node'')
*{{l|ja|また}}、{{l|ja|又}} – also, again (''mata'')
*{{l|ja|または}}、{{l|ja|又は}} – or alternatively (''matawa'')
*{{l|ja|も}} – also, too (''mo'')
*{{l|ja|や}} – and (''ya'')

===Final===
<!--終助詞-->
*{{l|ja|ね}} – emphasis and question marker, equivalent to "right?" (''ne'')
*{{l|ja|か}} – question marker (''ka'')
*{{l|ja|な}} – the copula particle used after quasi-adjectives (''na'')
*{{l|ja|かしら}} – I wonder (''kashira'')
*{{l|ja|さ}} – -ness (''sa'')
*{{l|ja|っけ}} – particle indicating that the speaker is trying to recall some information ["What class is next ''-kke''?"] (''-kke'')

===Adverbial===
<!--副助詞-->
*{{l|ja|こそ}} – emphasis (''koso'')
*{{l|ja|さえ}} – even (''sae'')
*{{l|ja|しか}} – only (''shika'')
*{{l|ja|すら}} – even (''sura'')
*{{l|ja|くらい}}、{{l|ja|ぐらい}} – approximately, about (''kurai'')
*{{l|ja|だけ}} – only, as much as (''dake'')
*{{l|ja|だって}} – however (''datte'')
*{{l|ja|ったら}} – casual topic marker (''ttara'') [colloquial form of ''to ittara'' (if you refer to ~; as for ~)
*{{l|ja|って}} – said that (''tte'')
*{{l|ja|でも}} – also, or (''demo'')
*{{l|ja|どころ}} – (''particle used to indicate that what precedes it is an extreme example and strongly negates it'') (''dokoro'')
*{{l|ja|など}} – for example (''nado'')
*{{l|ja|なら}} – if [for verbs]; subject marker [for nouns] (''nara'')
*{{l|ja|なんか}} – casual undervalue, dislike, lack (''nanka'')
*{{l|ja|なんて}} – casual undervalue, dislike, lack (''nante'')<!-- [both ''nanka'' and ''nante'' are casual: formal undervalue adverbial is など, ''nado''] -->
*{{l|ja|は}} – topic marker (''wa'') [although ''ha'' is the hiragana used, ''wa'' is the pronunciation)
*{{l|ja|ばかり}}、{{l|ja|ばっかり}} – just, full of, only (''bakari'')
*{{l|ja|まで}} – until (''made'')
*{{l|ja|も}} – too, also (''mo'')
